it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std

Class BigraphBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std.BigraphBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BigraphBuilder<Control>, BigraphHandler<Control>, Owner, java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class BigraphBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements BigraphBuilder<Control>, java.lang.Cloneable
    This class provides services for the creation and manipulation of bigraphs since instances of Bigraph are immutable. For efficiency reasons immutability can be relaxed by the user (cf. outerCompose(Bigraph, boolean)) by allowing the reuse of (parts) of the arguments. Notice that, if not handled properly, the reuse of bigraphs can cause inconsistencies e.g. as a consequence of the reuse of a bigraphs held by a rewriting rule as its redex or reactum.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BigraphBuilder(Bigraph big)
      Creates a builder from (a copy of) the given bigraph.
      BigraphBuilder(Signature sig)
      Initially the builder describes an empty bigraph for the given signature.

        public Bigraph makeBigraph()
        Returns the bigraph build so far. The new bigraph is independent from any other operation done by the builder.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        a bigraph.

      • makeBigraph

        public Bigraph makeBigraph(boolean close)
        Return the bigraph build so far. The new bigraph is independent from any other operation done by the builder. The new bigraph can be created more efficiently if the builder is closed by the same method call.
        Parameters:
        close - disables the builder to perform any other operation.
        Returns:
        a bigraph.

      • leftJuxtapose

        public void leftJuxtapose(Bigraph graph)
        Juxtapose the current bigraphbuilder with the bigraph in input.
        Roots and sites of the bigraph will precede those of the bigraphbuilder in the resulting bigraphbuilder.
        Parameters:
        graph - bigraph that will be juxtaposed.

      • leftJuxtapose

        public void leftJuxtapose(Bigraph graph,
                 boolean reuse)
        Juxtapose the current bigraphbuilder with the bigraph in input.
        Roots and sites of the bigraph will precede those of the bigraphbuilder in the resulting bigraphbuilder.
        Parameters:
        graph - bigraph that will be juxtaposed.
        reuse - flag. If true, the bigraph in input won't be copied.

      • outerNest

        public void outerNest(Bigraph graph)
        Nest bigraph in input with the current bigraphbuilder.
        Nesting, differently from composition, add bigraph's outername to bigraphbuilder if they aren't already present. It will then perform the standard composition.
        Parameters:
        graph - the "inner" bigraph

      • outerNest

        public void outerNest(Bigraph graph,
             boolean reuse)
        Nest bigraph in input with the current bigraphbuilder.
        Nesting, differently from composition, add bigraph's outername to bigraphbuilder if they aren't already present. It will then perform the standard composition.
        Parameters:
        graph - the "inner" bigraph
        reuse - flag. If true, the bigraph in input won't be copied.

      • leftParallelProduct

        public void leftParallelProduct(Bigraph graph)
        Juxtapose bigraph in input with the current bigraphbuilder.
        ParallelProduct, differently from the normal juxtapose, doesn't need disjoint sets of outernames for the two bigraphs. Common outernames will be merged.
        Roots and sites of the bigraph will precede those of the bigraphbuilder in the resulting bigraphbuilder.
        Parameters:
        graph - bigraph that will be juxtaposed.

      • leftParallelProduct

        public void leftParallelProduct(Bigraph graph,
                       boolean reuse)
        Juxtapose bigraph in input with the current bigraphbuilder.
        ParallelProduct, differently from the normal juxtapose, doesn't need disjoint sets of outernames for the two bigraphs. Common outernames will be merged.
        Roots and sites of the bigraph will precede those of the bigraphbuilder in the resulting bigraphbuilder.
        Parameters:
        graph - bigraph that will be juxtaposed.
        reuse - flag. If true, the bigraph in input won't be copied.

      • rightParallelProduct

        public void rightParallelProduct(Bigraph graph)
        Juxtapose the current bigraphbuilder with the bigraph in input.
        ParallelProduct, differently from the normal juxtapose, doesn't need disjoint sets of outernames for the two bigraphs. Common outernames will be merged.
        Roots and sites of the bigraphbuilder will precede those of the bigraph in the resulting bigraphbuilder.
        Parameters:
        graph - bigraph that will be juxtaposed.
